description:
Our Mission: Making friends with similar interests. 

An opportunity for Chicago area cannabis consumers to get together and be social. Too often cannabis consumption has been looked down upon and laws have kept people indoors. We're all about connecting people in community to break down stereotypes and social stigma.

With medical cannabis dispensaries open and laws changing in Illinois this is our time to get together and have some fun.

Of course we cannot yet consume cannabis in public, but this will be a great opportunity for us all to meet more like minded people.

We will have some events at local restaurants, bars, beaches, and even some private homes.

Please join and we will schedule some times and dates to get together.

Our boundaries are ground rules for this community to grow sustainably and maintain a safe space for all cannabis consumers.

• no onsite consumption of cannabis during the event

• nonviolent communication and conflict resolutions

• mutual respect for everyone in our community
name: Cannabis 420 Social Club

description:
Living in Chicago as a conservative has got me empathizing with Johnathon Living Seagull. Just wanted to meet up with some like minded people who wouldn't accuse me of hating old people because I want to control my own retirement, or hating kids because I support choice in education.
Fair warning, I'm more of a conservative libertarian/ classical liberal, but in this city I'm not alienating anyone who doesn't want to light tax money on fire.
If you, like me, are feeling like the last sane person in a psych ward, let me know and we can grab a beer or something.
name: Chicago Conservatives Meetup

description:
In just the first 10 days of his Presidency, Donald Trump has threatened undocumented immigrants with deportation, banned Muslim refugees and legal residents from seven countries and threatened to rollback decades of climate-change policy. 

No matter what you believe politically, these policies must be resisted.

As programmers, we can offer technical capabilities to civic groups that are on the front-lines of protecting those most affected by these policies. The goal is to organize a rapid-response team of programmers, web-developers and engineers from Chicago that can build tools and applications to aide sister-organizations scale their efforts.

First sprint-planning meeting is next week.
name: Code Progressive

organizer.bio: I'm Rebelle in Chief of Rebellious Magazine for Women , a Chicago-based online feminist publication that launched in March 2012 & relaunched in March 2016. I'm looking forward to connecting with other women entrepreneurs, business owners & Rebelles.
organizer.name: Karen Hawkins

description: Rebellious Magazine for Women is Chicago's most Rebellious feminist publication. This group is for anyone interested in joining our events & shenanigans, including the Annual Rebellious Magazine Feminist Prom Fundraiser. We're a diverse, inclusive & fun-loving group. Sometimes we raffle off vibrators.
name: Rebellious Magazine for Women

description:
Represent Us brings together conservatives, progressives, and everyone in between to pass powerful anti-corruption laws that stop political bribery, end secret money, and fix our broken elections.

Representation Day is a national day of action held annually by Represent.Us chapters all across the country. On Sunday, April 15, we are convening local groups and individuals working on democracy reform for a social event to to celebrate local successes and strengthen the anti-corruption movement in Illinois.
name: Represent Us: Chicagoland Anti-Corruption Meetup

description:
This group is for anyone interested in reading about economics in general or about social democracy/democratic socialism, broadly speaking, with no fixed ideology of any kind. People from any political background are welcome!

We might read: 

1. Contemporary texts like Thomas Piketty's "Capital in the Twenty-First Century," Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee's "The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies," Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler's "Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think," Joseph Stiglitz's "The Price of Inequality: How Today's Divided Society Endangers Our Future," Matt Taibbi's "The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap," Richard Wolff's "Democracy at Work: A Cure for Capitalism," David Harvey's "Seventeen Contradictions and the End of Capitalism," Arundhati Roy's "Capitalism: A Ghost Story," Michael Mandelbaum's "The Road to Global Prosperity," Luigi Zingales's "A Capitalism for the People: Recapturing the Lost Genius of American Prosperity," John Micklethwait and Adrian Wooldridge's "The Fourth Revolution: The Global Race to Reinvent the State," or Timothy Geithner's "Stress Test: Reflections on Financial Crises."

2. Economics or economic history classics from authors like Appleby, Becker, Blaug, Collier, Cowen, Easterly, Eichengreen, Ferguson, Frieden, Friedman, Hayek, Heilbroner, Keynes, Krugman, Landes, Lind, Mankiw, Nasar, Polanyi, Rodrik, Rothbard, Sachs, Schumpeter, Shiller, Smith, Stiglitz, von Mises.

3. Democratic socialist classics from authors like Adorno, Allende, Bell, Bellamy, Chavez, Chomsky, Cohen, Cole, Davis, Debs, Dewey, Du Bois, Dyson, Ehrenreich, Engels, Gramsci, Habermas, Harrington, Harvey, Hayden, Hobsbawm, Hook, Horkheimer, Howe, Judt, King, Klein, Lipset, Luxemburg, Mandela, Marable, Marcuse, Marx, Mills, Nehru, Nichols, Niebuhr, Orwell, Piven, Rawls, Rorty, Russell, Shaw, Thomas, Thompson, Trotsky, the Webbs, West, Wilson, Zinn - or any others suggested by members! (I am no expert on the subject, and, after a political slumber, am only beginning to develop my knowledge of it.) 

We can organize the reading list democratically, with choice of selection by consensus or by a rotating member.
name: Chicago Economics & Social Democracy Reading Club

description:
Both political parties have some valuable ideas to offer, but politicians on both sides are too busy operating at the fringes of their own party to get anything done. We need to shake up the system with independents as well as left-leaning and right-leaning moderates!

Come out to chat about politics, make some friends with similar views, and help make an impact!
name: Unite America - Chicago Chapter

organizer.bio: I manage several Meetup Groups. Adding a few more.
organizer.name: Edmund Dantés Hamilton

description: Obama for Technology | Technology for Obama was created on My.BarackObama.com in February 2007 shortly after Barack Obama announced his intentions to run for President of the United States of America (POTUS). We are the "original" Technology for Obama group (just Google "Technology for Obama" or "Obama For Technology" and watch the videos, etc). Because I organize several Meetups, I've decided create this "Technology For Obama" Meetup Group to help get President Barack Obama reelected in 2012. Meetings will be held in my downtown Loop Chicago office. More details to follow. Join me in getting POTUS reelected so he can finish what he started and we can get the Jobs Act passed! Are you in?
name: Technology for Obama Meetup Group

description:
People who are looking for an outlet from the current political climate and an opportunity to discuss activism opportunities and/or just vent. This group is right for you if...

1) You feel overwhelmed with the daily onslaught of crazy, coming out of the White House.

2) You are welcoming and respectful of people no matter their race, religion, gender or sexual identity.
name: Keeping Sane in the Insanity (K-Siti)!

description:
Protest is the new brunch.

But, we still want actual brunch too! We meet for monthly brunches at different restaurants in neighborhoods across the city. At brunch we partake in eggs, beverages of all kinds, and small actions to further the progressive agenda in this country.
name: The Mimosa Party

description:
If you think our country is falling apart because liberals and conservatives don't know how to talk to each other anymore, you’re right, and this meetup is for you. Here, we attempt to foster conversation across the liberal/conservative DMZ, focusing as much on casual experiences as on deeper conversations about the nature of politics and our political system.

Group leadership includes members from across the political spectrum, and all ideologies are welcome -- leftist to libertarian, tea party to teamster.
name: The Bridge: Liberal and Conservative Common Grounds

organizer.bio: Beginners Spanish as a third language.

National issues are NOT encouraged.
State issues are encouraged.

name: Social Action Informed Network (SAIN)

description:
The Urantia Book, first published by Urantia Foundation in 1955, presents us with the origin, history, and destiny of humanity. It answers questions about God, life in the inhabited universe, the history and future of this world, and it includes an uplifting narrative of the life and teachings of Jesus.

The Urantia Book portrays our relationship with God the Father. All human beings are the sons and daughters of a loving God and therefore brothers and sisters in the family of God. The book provides new spiritual truth for modern men and women and a pathway to a personal relationship with God.

Building on the world's religious heritage, The Urantia Book describes an endless destiny for humankind, teaching that living faith is the key to personal spiritual progress and eternal survival. It also describes God’s plan for the progressive evolution of individuals, human society, and the universe as a whole.

Many people around the world have said that reading The Urantia Book has profoundly inspired them to reach deeper levels of spiritual growth. It has given them new meaning to life and the desire to be of service to humanity.

Official Site for First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://urantiachicago.org/

Official facebook 'page' site for the First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://www.facebook.com/theurantiabook/

Audio Versions

http://urantia-book.org/audio/iPod_Audiobook/index_ipod_audiobook.html

http://urantia-book.org/index_audio.htm

http://www.urantia.org/audio

http://truthbook.com/urantia-book/audio-downloads


THE FORUM STUDY GROUP meets in the Gallery Room at the United Church of Rogers Park (UCRP) http://www.ucrogerspark.org , located at the corner of Ashland Ave. (1600W) and Morse Ave. (6934N) in Chicago. Enter the UCRP building through the door at 1545 W. Morse Ave. If door is not open, ring the bell. Look for the signs directing you to the Gallery Room on the second floor. After entering, immediately turn left and proceed up one flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs, go through the doorway to the left, the Gallery Room is then to the right. There is also an elevator available which stops directly facing the Gallery Room.
name: First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

organizer.bio:
I joined Meetup to network with like minded people.

I want freedom and liberty restored not only to my country,
but  to the whole world as well.  

Human Race: it's time to get off your knees.

Who's with me?
organizer.name: rob

Notice:

The Chicago Tea Party meetup.com is a peaceful gathering of people, made up of men and women who believe that man has natural unalienable right to life, liberty, property and pursuit of happiness, given to us by our Father, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob ;

The purpose of the Chicago Tea Party meetup is to give people the opportunity to meet other people with similar interests ;

Meanings and definitions of words herein stand in harmony with Noah Webster's 1828 dictionary ;

i, a man, Robert Joseph : family Willett

unalienable rights retained

one of the people of Illinois, 1818 ;

1) You feel overwhelmed with the daily onslaught of crazy, coming out of the White House.

2) You are welcoming and respectful of people no matter their race, religion, gender or sexual identity.
name: Keeping Sane in the Insanity (K-Siti)!

description:
Protest is the new brunch.

But, we still want actual brunch too! We meet for monthly brunches at different restaurants in neighborhoods across the city. At brunch we partake in eggs, beverages of all kinds, and small actions to further the progressive agenda in this country.
name: The Mimosa Party

description:
If you think our country is falling apart because liberals and conservatives don't know how to talk to each other anymore, you’re right, and this meetup is for you. Here, we attempt to foster conversation across the liberal/conservative DMZ, focusing as much on casual experiences as on deeper conversations about the nature of politics and our political system.

Group leadership includes members from across the political spectrum, and all ideologies are welcome -- leftist to libertarian, tea party to teamster.
name: The Bridge: Liberal and Conservative Common Grounds

description:
The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) is the largest socialist organization in the United States, and the principal U.S. affiliate of the Socialist International. DSA's members are building progressive movements for social change while establishing an openly democratic socialist presence in American communities and politics.

At the root of our socialism is a profound commitment to democracy, as means and end. As we are unlikely to see an immediate end to capitalism tomorrow, DSA fights for reforms today that will weaken the power of corporations and increase the power of working people.
name: Chicago Democratic Socialists of America Chapter

description:
This is a group to get together and learn about the issues of the day in a social -meet people- learn & - respect others venue.

This is 99% group so if you are in the 1% your ideas are welcome but will not be in the majority
name: Social Action Informed Network (SAIN)

description:
The Urantia Book, first published by Urantia Foundation in 1955, presents us with the origin, history, and destiny of humanity. It answers questions about God, life in the inhabited universe, the history and future of this world, and it includes an uplifting narrative of the life and teachings of Jesus.

The Urantia Book portrays our relationship with God the Father. All human beings are the sons and daughters of a loving God and therefore brothers and sisters in the family of God. The book provides new spiritual truth for modern men and women and a pathway to a personal relationship with God.

Building on the world's religious heritage, The Urantia Book describes an endless destiny for humankind, teaching that living faith is the key to personal spiritual progress and eternal survival. It also describes God’s plan for the progressive evolution of individuals, human society, and the universe as a whole.

Many people around the world have said that reading The Urantia Book has profoundly inspired them to reach deeper levels of spiritual growth. It has given them new meaning to life and the desire to be of service to humanity.

Official Site for First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://urantiachicago.org/

Official facebook 'page' site for the First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://www.facebook.com/theurantiabook/

Audio Versions

http://urantia-book.org/audio/iPod_Audiobook/index_ipod_audiobook.html

http://urantia-book.org/index_audio.htm

http://www.urantia.org/audio

http://truthbook.com/urantia-book/audio-downloads


THE FORUM STUDY GROUP meets in the Gallery Room at the United Church of Rogers Park (UCRP) http://www.ucrogerspark.org , located at the corner of Ashland Ave. (1600W) and Morse Ave. (6934N) in Chicago. Enter the UCRP building through the door at 1545 W. Morse Ave. If door is not open, ring the bell. Look for the signs directing you to the Gallery Room on the second floor. After entering, immediately turn left and proceed up one flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs, go through the doorway to the left, the Gallery Room is then to the right. There is also an elevator available which stops directly facing the Gallery Room.
name: First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

description:
Our Mission: Making friends with similar interests. 

An opportunity for Chicago area cannabis consumers to get together and be social. Too often cannabis consumption has been looked down upon and laws have kept people indoors. We're all about connecting people in community to break down stereotypes and social stigma.

With medical cannabis dispensaries open and laws changing in Illinois this is our time to get together and have some fun.

Of course we cannot yet consume cannabis in public, but this will be a great opportunity for us all to meet more like minded people.

We will have some events at local restaurants, bars, beaches, and even some private homes.

Please join and we will schedule some times and dates to get together.

Our boundaries are ground rules for this community to grow sustainably and maintain a safe space for all cannabis consumers.

• no onsite consumption of cannabis during the event

• nonviolent communication and conflict resolutions

• mutual respect for everyone in our community
name: Cannabis 420 Social Club

description:
Living in Chicago as a conservative has got me empathizing with Johnathon Living Seagull. Just wanted to meet up with some like minded people who wouldn't accuse me of hating old people because I want to control my own retirement, or hating kids because I support choice in education.
Fair warning, I'm more of a conservative libertarian/ classical liberal, but in this city I'm not alienating anyone who doesn't want to light tax money on fire.
If you, like me, are feeling like the last sane person in a psych ward, let me know and we can grab a beer or something.
name: Chicago Conservatives Meetup

next_event.name: Meet Sanj Mohip - LP Chicago May Meeting

description: Meet Libertarians near you! Come to The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup to share your opinions on today's political climate and issues and learn how you can contribute to America's political future. Everyone interested in Libertarianism is welcome! Visit http://www.lpchicago.org and http://www.facebook.com/chicagolp for more information.
name: The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup Group

description:
We are a passionate group dedicated to ending violence and spreading a culture of peace with local and global communities.

If you love peace and desire to be the change - please join us in our campaign!
name: Calling an End to Gun Violence

description:
In just the first 10 days of his Presidency, Donald Trump has threatened undocumented immigrants with deportation, banned Muslim refugees and legal residents from seven countries and threatened to rollback decades of climate-change policy. 

No matter what you believe politically, these policies must be resisted.

As programmers, we can offer technical capabilities to civic groups that are on the front-lines of protecting those most affected by these policies. The goal is to organize a rapid-response team of programmers, web-developers and engineers from Chicago that can build tools and applications to aide sister-organizations scale their efforts.

First sprint-planning meeting is next week.
name: Code Progressive

organizer.bio: I'm Rebelle in Chief of Rebellious Magazine for Women , a Chicago-based online feminist publication that launched in March 2012 & relaunched in March 2016. I'm looking forward to connecting with other women entrepreneurs, business owners & Rebelles.
organizer.name: Karen Hawkins

description: Rebellious Magazine for Women is Chicago's most Rebellious feminist publication. This group is for anyone interested in joining our events & shenanigans, including the Annual Rebellious Magazine Feminist Prom Fundraiser. We're a diverse, inclusive & fun-loving group. Sometimes we raffle off vibrators.
name: Rebellious Magazine for Women

description:
Represent Us brings together conservatives, progressives, and everyone in between to pass powerful anti-corruption laws that stop political bribery, end secret money, and fix our broken elections.

Representation Day is a national day of action held annually by Represent.Us chapters all across the country. On Sunday, April 15, we are convening local groups and individuals working on democracy reform for a social event to to celebrate local successes and strengthen the anti-corruption movement in Illinois.
name: Represent Us: Chicagoland Anti-Corruption Meetup

description:
This group is for anyone interested in reading about economics in general or about social democracy/democratic socialism, broadly speaking, with no fixed ideology of any kind. People from any political background are welcome!

We might read: 

1. Contemporary texts like Thomas Piketty's "Capital in the Twenty-First Century," Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee's "The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies," Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler's "Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think," Joseph Stiglitz's "The Price of Inequality: How Today's Divided Society Endangers Our Future," Matt Taibbi's "The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap," Richard Wolff's "Democracy at Work: A Cure for Capitalism," David Harvey's "Seventeen Contradictions and the End of Capitalism," Arundhati Roy's "Capitalism: A Ghost Story," Michael Mandelbaum's "The Road to Global Prosperity," Luigi Zingales's "A Capitalism for the People: Recapturing the Lost Genius of American Prosperity," John Micklethwait and Adrian Wooldridge's "The Fourth Revolution: The Global Race to Reinvent the State," or Timothy Geithner's "Stress Test: Reflections on Financial Crises."

2. Economics or economic history classics from authors like Appleby, Becker, Blaug, Collier, Cowen, Easterly, Eichengreen, Ferguson, Frieden, Friedman, Hayek, Heilbroner, Keynes, Krugman, Landes, Lind, Mankiw, Nasar, Polanyi, Rodrik, Rothbard, Sachs, Schumpeter, Shiller, Smith, Stiglitz, von Mises.

3. Democratic socialist classics from authors like Adorno, Allende, Bell, Bellamy, Chavez, Chomsky, Cohen, Cole, Davis, Debs, Dewey, Du Bois, Dyson, Ehrenreich, Engels, Gramsci, Habermas, Harrington, Harvey, Hayden, Hobsbawm, Hook, Horkheimer, Howe, Judt, King, Klein, Lipset, Luxemburg, Mandela, Marable, Marcuse, Marx, Mills, Nehru, Nichols, Niebuhr, Orwell, Piven, Rawls, Rorty, Russell, Shaw, Thomas, Thompson, Trotsky, the Webbs, West, Wilson, Zinn - or any others suggested by members! (I am no expert on the subject, and, after a political slumber, am only beginning to develop my knowledge of it.) 

We can organize the reading list democratically, with choice of selection by consensus or by a rotating member.
name: Chicago Economics & Social Democracy Reading Club

description:
If you think our country is falling apart because liberals and conservatives don't know how to talk to each other anymore, you’re right, and this meetup is for you. Come out to chat about politics, make some friends with similar views, and help make an impact!
name: Unite America - Chicago Chapter

organizer.bio: I manage several Meetup Groups. Adding a few more.
organizer.name: Edmund Dantés Hamilton

description: Obama for Technology | Technology for Obama was created on My.BarackObama.com in February 2007 shortly after Barack Obama announced his intentions to run for President of the United States of America (POTUS). We are the "original" Technology for Obama group (just Google "Technology for Obama" or "Obama For Technology" and watch the videos, etc). Because I organize several Meetups, I've decided create this "Technology For Obama" Meetup Group to help get President Barack Obama reelected in 2012. Meetings will be held in my downtown Loop Chicago office. More details to follow. Join me in getting POTUS reelected so he can finish what he started and we can get the Jobs Act passed! Are you in?
name: Technology for Obama Meetup Group

description:
The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) is the largest socialist organization in the United States, and the principal U.S. affiliate of the Socialist International. DSA's members are building progressive movements for social change while establishing an openly democratic socialist presence in American communities and politics.

At the root of our socialism is a profound commitment to democracy, as means and end. As we are unlikely to see an immediate end to capitalism tomorrow, DSA fights for reforms today that will weaken the power of corporations and increase the power of working people.
name: Chicago Democratic Socialists of America Chapter

description:
This is a group to get together and learn about the issues of the day in a social -meet people- learn & - respect others venue.

This is 99% group so if you are in the 1% your ideas are welcome but will not be in the majority
name: Social Action Informed Network (SAIN)

description:
The Urantia Book, first published by Urantia Foundation in 1955, presents us with the origin, history, and destiny of humanity. It answers questions about God, life in the inhabited universe, the history and future of this world, and it includes an uplifting narrative of the life and teachings of Jesus.

The Urantia Book portrays our relationship with God the Father. All human beings are the sons and daughters of a loving God and therefore brothers and sisters in the family of God. The book provides new spiritual truth for modern men and women and a pathway to a personal relationship with God.

Building on the world's religious heritage, The Urantia Book describes an endless destiny for humankind, teaching that living faith is the key to personal spiritual progress and eternal survival. It also describes God’s plan for the progressive evolution of individuals, human society, and the universe as a whole.

Many people around the world have said that reading The Urantia Book has profoundly inspired them to reach deeper levels of spiritual growth. It has given them new meaning to life and the desire to be of service to humanity.

Official Site for First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://urantiachicago.org/

Official facebook 'page' site for the First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://www.facebook.com/theurantiabook/

Audio Versions

http://urantia-book.org/audio/iPod_Audiobook/index_ipod_audiobook.html

http://urantia-book.org/index_audio.htm

http://www.urantia.org/audio

http://truthbook.com/urantia-book/audio-downloads


THE FORUM STUDY GROUP meets in the Gallery Room at the United Church of Rogers Park (UCRP) http://www.ucrogerspark.org , located at the corner of Ashland Ave. (1600W) and Morse Ave. (6934N) in Chicago. Enter the UCRP building through the door at 1545 W. Morse Ave. If door is not open, ring the bell. Look for the signs directing you to the Gallery Room on the second floor. After entering, immediately turn left and proceed up one flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs, go through the doorway to the left, the Gallery Room is then to the right. There is also an elevator available which stops directly facing the Gallery Room.
name: First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

Notice:

Mission Statement :

The Chicago Tea Party meetup.com is a peaceful gathering of people, made up of men and women who believe that man has natural unalienable right to life, liberty, property and pursuit of happiness, given to us by our Father, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob ;

Meanings and definitions of words herein stand in harmony with Noah Webster's 1828 dictionary ;

i, a man, Robert Joseph : family Willett

unalienable rights retained

group organizer of the Chicago Tea Party at meetup
name: The Chicago Tea Party

description: This is a group of Ron Paul fans Our mission is to promote and defend the great American principles of individual liberty, constitutional government, sound money, free markets, and a noninterventionist foreign policy, by means of educational and social activities.
name: Greater Chicago Ron Paul Meetup

organizer.bio: Truth Deficit Disorder Specialist (in training-my work will never be done)No Liberal Left Behind Program(link for updating your Meetup profile at bottom of this list)
organizer.name: Rich Johns

description:
Our Mission: Making friends with similar interests. 

An opportunity for Chicago area cannabis consumers to get together and be social. Too often cannabis consumption has been looked down upon and laws have kept people indoors. We're all about connecting people in community to break down stereotypes and social stigma.

With medical cannabis dispensaries open and laws changing in Illinois this is our time to get together and have some fun.

Of course we cannot yet consume cannabis in public, but this will be a great opportunity for us all to meet more like minded people.

We will have some events at local restaurants, bars, beaches, and even some private homes.

Please join and we will schedule some times and dates to get together.

Our boundaries are ground rules for this community to grow sustainably and maintain a safe space for all cannabis consumers.

• no onsite consumption of cannabis during the event

• nonviolent communication and conflict resolutions

• mutual respect for everyone in our community
name: Cannabis 420 Social Club

description:
Living in Chicago as a conservative has got me empathizing with Johnathon Living Seagull. Just wanted to meet up with some like minded people who wouldn't accuse me of hating old people because I want to control my own retirement, or hating kids because I support choice in education.
Fair warning, I'm more of a conservative libertarian/ classical liberal, but in this city I'm not alienating anyone who doesn't want to light tax money on fire.
If you, like me, are feeling like the last sane person in a psych ward, let me know and we can grab a beer or something.
name: Chicago Conservatives Meetup

next_event.name: Phone Bank for Equal Rights Amendment (ERA) in Oak Park

organizer.bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
organizer.name: #Resist Organizer

description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's OK if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall - start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind
- Be Respectful
- Be Real
name: #Resist: Chicago

next_event.name: Meet Sanj Mohip - LP Chicago May Meeting

description: Meet Libertarians near you! Come to The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup to share your opinions on today's political climate and issues and learn how you can contribute to America's political future. Everyone interested in Libertarianism is welcome! Visit http://www.lpchicago.org and http://www.facebook.com/chicagolp for more information.
name: The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup Group

description:
We are a passionate group dedicated to ending violence and spreading a culture of peace with local and global communities.

If you love peace and desire to be the change - please join us in our campaign!
name: Calling an End to Gun Violence

description:
In just the first 10 days of his Presidency, Donald Trump has threatened undocumented immigrants with deportation, banned Muslim refugees and legal residents from seven countries and threatened to rollback decades of climate-change policy. 

No matter what you believe politically, these policies must be resisted.

As programmers, we can offer technical capabilities to civic groups that are on the front-lines of protecting those most affected by these policies. The goal is to organize a rapid-response team of programmers, web-developers and engineers from Chicago that can build tools and applications to aide sister-organizations scale their efforts.

First sprint-planning meeting is next week.
name: Code Progressive

organizer.bio: I'm Rebelle in Chief of Rebellious Magazine for Women , a Chicago-based online feminist publication that launched in March 2012 & relaunched in March 2016. I'm looking forward to connecting with other women entrepreneurs, business owners & Rebelles.
organizer.name: Karen Hawkins

description: Rebellious Magazine for Women is Chicago's most Rebellious feminist publication. This group is for anyone interested in joining our events & shenanigans, including the Annual Rebellious Magazine Feminist Prom Fundraiser. We're a diverse, inclusive & fun-loving group. Sometimes we raffle off vibrators.
name: Rebellious Magazine for Women

description:
Represent Us brings together conservatives, progressives, and everyone in between to pass powerful anti-corruption laws that stop political bribery, end secret money, and fix our broken elections.

Representation Day is a national day of action held annually by Represent.Us chapters all across the country. On Sunday, April 15, we are convening local groups and individuals working on democracy reform for a social event to to celebrate local successes and strengthen the anti-corruption movement in Illinois.
name: Represent Us: Chicagoland Anti-Corruption Meetup

description:
This group is for anyone interested in reading about economics in general or about social democracy/democratic socialism, broadly speaking, with no fixed ideology of any kind. People from any political background are welcome!

We might read: 

1. Contemporary texts like Thomas Piketty's "Capital in the Twenty-First Century," Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee's "The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies," Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler's "Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think," Joseph Stiglitz's "The Price of Inequality: How Today's Divided Society Endangers Our Future," Matt Taibbi's "The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap," Richard Wolff's "Democracy at Work: A Cure for Capitalism," David Harvey's "Seventeen Contradictions and the End of Capitalism," Arundhati Roy's "Capitalism: A Ghost Story," Michael Mandelbaum's "The Road to Global Prosperity," Luigi Zingales's "A Capitalism for the People: Recapturing the Lost Genius of American Prosperity," John Micklethwait and Adrian Wooldridge's "The Fourth Revolution: The Global Race to Reinvent the State," or Timothy Geithner's "Stress Test: Reflections on Financial Crises."

2. Economics or economic history classics from authors like Appleby, Becker, Blaug, Collier, Cowen, Easterly, Eichengreen, Ferguson, Frieden, Friedman, Hayek, Heilbroner, Keynes, Krugman, Landes, Lind, Mankiw, Nasar, Polanyi, Rodrik, Rothbard, Sachs, Schumpeter, Shiller, Smith, Stiglitz, von Mises.

3. Democratic socialist classics from authors like Adorno, Allende, Bell, Bellamy, Chavez, Chomsky, Cohen, Cole, Davis, Debs, Dewey, Du Bois, Dyson, Ehrenreich, Engels, Gramsci, Habermas, Harrington, Harvey, Hayden, Hobsbawm, Hook, Horkheimer, Howe, Judt, King, Klein, Lipset, Luxemburg, Mandela, Marable, Marcuse, Marx, Mills, Nehru, Nichols, Niebuhr, Orwell, Piven, Rawls, Rorty, Russell, Shaw, Thomas, Thompson, Trotsky, the Webbs, West, Wilson, Zinn - or any others suggested by members! (I am no expert on the subject, and, after a political slumber, am only beginning to develop my knowledge of it.) 

We can organize the reading list democratically, with choice of selection by consensus or by a rotating member.
name: Chicago Economics & Social Democracy Reading Club

description:
Both political parties have some valuable ideas to offer, but politicians on both sides are too busy operating at the fringes of their own party to get anything done. We need to shake up the system with independents as well as left-leaning and right-leaning moderates!

Come out to chat about politics, make some friends with similar views, and help make an impact!
name: Unite America - Chicago Chapter

organizer.bio: I manage several Meetup Groups. Adding a few more.
organizer.name: Edmund Dantés Hamilton

description: Obama for Technology | Technology for Obama was created on My.BarackObama.com in February 2007 shortly after Barack Obama announced his intentions to run for President of the United States of America (POTUS). We are the "original" Technology for Obama group (just Google "Technology for Obama" or "Obama For Technology" and watch the videos, etc). Because I organize several Meetups, I've decided create this "Technology For Obama" Meetup Group to help get President Barack Obama reelected in 2012. Meetings will be held in my downtown Loop Chicago office. More details to follow. Join me in getting POTUS reelected so he can finish what he started and we can get the Jobs Act passed! Are you in?
name: Technology for Obama Meetup Group

description:
People who are looking for an outlet from the current political climate and an opportunity to discuss activism opportunities and/or just vent. This group is right for you if...

1) You feel overwhelmed with the daily onslaught of crazy, coming out of the White House.

2) You are welcoming and respectful of people no matter their race, religion, gender or sexual identity.
name: Keeping Sane in the Insanity (K-Siti)!

description:
Protest is the new brunch.

But, we still want actual brunch too! We meet for monthly brunches at different restaurants in neighborhoods across the city. At brunch we partake in eggs, beverages of all kinds, and small actions to further the progressive agenda in this country.
name: The Mimosa Party

description:
If you think our country is falling apart because liberals and conservatives don't know how to talk to each other anymore, you’re right, and this meetup is for you. Here, we attempt to foster conversation across the liberal/conservative DMZ, focusing as much on casual experiences as on deeper conversations about the nature of politics and our political system.

Group leadership includes members from across the political spectrum, and all ideologies are welcome -- leftist to libertarian, tea party to teamster.
name: The Bridge: Liberal and Conservative Common Grounds

name: The Mimosa Party

description:
This group is for anyone interested in reading about economics in general or about social democracy/democratic socialism, broadly speaking, with no fixed ideology of any kind. People from any political background are welcome!

We might read: 

1. Contemporary texts like Thomas Piketty's "Capital in the Twenty-First Century," Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee's "The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies," Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler's "Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think," Joseph Stiglitz's "The Price of Inequality: How Today's Divided Society Endangers Our Future," Matt Taibbi's "The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap," Richard Wolff's "Democracy at Work: A Cure for Capitalism," David Harvey's "Seventeen Contradictions and the End of Capitalism," Arundhati Roy's "Capitalism: A Ghost Story," Michael Mandelbaum's "The Road to Global Prosperity," Luigi Zingales's "A Capitalism for the People: Recapturing the Lost Genius of American Prosperity," John Micklethwait and Adrian Wooldridge's "The Fourth Revolution: The Global Race to Reinvent the State," or Timothy Geithner's "Stress Test: Reflections on Financial Crises."

2. Economics or economic history classics from authors like Appleby, Becker, Blaug, Collier, Cowen, Easterly, Eichengreen, Ferguson, Frieden, Friedman, Hayek, Heilbroner, Keynes, Krugman, Landes, Lind, Mankiw, Nasar, Polanyi, Rodrik, Rothbard, Sachs, Schumpeter, Shiller, Smith, Stiglitz, von Mises.

3. Democratic socialist classics from authors like Adorno, Allende, Bell, Bellamy, Chavez, Chomsky, Cohen, Cole, Davis, Debs, Dewey, Du Bois, Dyson, Ehrenreich, Engels, Gramsci, Habermas, Harrington, Harvey, Hayden, Hobsbawm, Hook, Horkheimer, Howe, Judt, King, Klein, Lipset, Luxemburg, Mandela, Marable, Marcuse, Marx, Mills, Nehru, Nichols, Niebuhr, Orwell, Piven, Rawls, Rorty, Russell, Shaw, Thomas, Thompson, Trotsky, the Webbs, West, Wilson, Zinn - or any others suggested by members! (I am no expert on the subject, and, after a political slumber, am only beginning to develop my knowledge of it.) 

We can organize the reading list democratically, with choice of selection by consensus or by a rotating member.
name: Chicago Economics & Social Democracy Reading Club

organizer.bio: I manage several Meetup Groups. Adding a few more.
organizer.name: Edmund Dantés Hamilton

description: Obama for Technology | Technology for Obama was created on My.BarackObama.com in February 2007 shortly after Barack Obama announced his intentions to run for President of the United States of America (POTUS). We are the "original" Technology for Obama group (just Google "Technology for Obama" or "Obama For Technology" and watch the videos, etc). Because I organize several Meetups, I've decided create this "Technology For Obama" Meetup Group to help get President Barack Obama reelected in 2012. Meetings will be held in my downtown Loop Chicago office. More details to follow. Join me in getting POTUS reelected so he can finish what he started and we can get the Jobs Act passed! Are you in?
name: Technology for Obama Meetup Group

description:
Our Mission: Making friends with similar interests. 

An opportunity for Chicago area cannabis consumers to get together and be social. Too often cannabis consumption has been looked down upon and laws have kept people indoors. We're all about connecting people in community to break down stereotypes and social stigma.

With medical cannabis dispensaries open and laws changing in Illinois this is our time to get together and have some fun.

Of course we cannot yet consume cannabis in public, but this will be a great opportunity for us all to meet more like minded people.

We will have some events at local restaurants, bars, beaches, and even some private homes.

Please join and we will schedule some times and dates to get together.

Our boundaries are ground rules for this community to grow sustainably and maintain a safe space for all cannabis consumers.

• no onsite consumption of cannabis during the event

• nonviolent communication and conflict resolutions

• mutual respect for everyone in our community
name: Cannabis 420 Social Club

description:
Living in Chicago as a conservative has got me empathizing with Johnathon Living Seagull. Just wanted to meet up with some like minded people who wouldn't accuse me of hating old people because I want to control my own retirement, or hating kids because I support choice in education.
Fair warning, I'm more of a conservative libertarian/ classical liberal, but in this city I'm not alienating anyone who doesn't want to light tax money on fire.
If you, like me, are feeling like the last sane person in a psych ward, let me know and we can grab a beer or something.
name: Chicago Conservatives Meetup

description:
We are a passionate group dedicated to ending violence and spreading a culture of peace with local and global communities.

If you love peace and desire to be the change - please join us in our campaign!

description:
In just the first 10 days of his Presidency, Donald Trump has threatened undocumented immigrants with deportation, banned Muslim refugees and legal residents from seven countries and threatened to rollback decades of climate-change policy. 

No matter what you believe politically, these policies must be resisted.

As programmers, we can offer technical capabilities to civic groups that are on the front-lines of protecting those most affected by these policies. The goal is to organize a rapid-response team of programmers, web-developers and engineers from Chicago that can build tools and applications to aide sister-organizations scale their efforts.

First sprint-planning meeting is next week.
name: Code Progressive

organizer.bio: I'm Rebelle in Chief of Rebellious Magazine for Women , a Chicago-based online feminist publication that launched in March 2012 & relaunched in March 2016. I'm looking forward to connecting with other women entrepreneurs, business owners & Rebelles.
organizer.name: Karen Hawkins

description: Rebellious Magazine for Women is Chicago's most Rebellious feminist publication. This group is for anyone interested in joining our events & shenanigans, including the Annual Rebellious Magazine Feminist Prom Fundraiser. We're a diverse, inclusive & fun-loving group. Sometimes we raffle off vibrators.
name: Rebellious Magazine for Women

description:
Represent Us brings together conservatives, progressives, and everyone in between to pass powerful anti-corruption laws that stop political bribery, end secret money, and fix our broken elections.

Representation Day is a national day of action held annually by Represent.Us chapters all across the country. On Sunday, April 15, we are convening local groups and individuals working on democracy reform for a social event to to celebrate local successes and strengthen the anti-corruption movement in Illinois.
name: Represent Us: Chicagoland Anti-Corruption Meetup

description:
The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) is the largest socialist organization in the United States, and the principal U.S. affiliate of the Socialist International. DSA's members are building progressive movements for social change while establishing an openly democratic socialist presence in American communities and politics.

At the root of our socialism is a profound commitment to democracy, as means and end. As we are unlikely to see an immediate end to capitalism tomorrow, DSA fights for reforms today that will weaken the power of corporations and increase the power of working people.
name: Chicago Democratic Socialists of America Chapter

description:
The Urantia Book, first published by Urantia Foundation in 1955, presents us with the origin, history, and destiny of humanity. It answers questions about God, life in the inhabited universe, the history and future of this world, and it includes an uplifting narrative of the life and teachings of Jesus.

The Urantia Book portrays our relationship with God the Father. All human beings are the sons and daughters of a loving God and therefore brothers and sisters in the family of God. The book provides new spiritual truth for modern men and women and a pathway to a personal relationship with God.

Building on the world's religious heritage, The Urantia Book describes an endless destiny for humankind, teaching that living faith is the key to personal spiritual progress and eternal survival. It also describes God’s plan for the progressive evolution of individuals, human society, and the universe as a whole.

Many people around the world have said that reading The Urantia Book has profoundly inspired them to reach deeper levels of spiritual growth. It has given them new meaning to life and the desire to be of service to humanity.

Official Site for First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://urantiachicago.org/

Official facebook 'page' site for the First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://www.facebook.com/theurantiabook/

Audio Versions

http://urantia-book.org/audio/iPod_Audiobook/index_ipod_audiobook.html

http://urantia-book.org/index_audio.htm

http://www.urantia.org/audio

http://truthbook.com/urantia-book/audio-downloads


THE FORUM STUDY GROUP meets in the Gallery Room at the United Church of Rogers Park (UCRP) http://www.ucrogerspark.org , located at the corner of Ashland Ave. (1600W) and Morse Ave. (6934N) in Chicago. Enter the UCRP building through the door at 1545 W. Morse Ave. If door is not open, ring the bell. Look for the signs directing you to the Gallery Room on the second floor. After entering, immediately turn left and proceed up one flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs, go through the doorway to the left, the Gallery Room is then to the right. There is also an elevator available which stops directly facing the Gallery Room.
name: First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

organizer.name: Rich Johns

description:
Our Mission: Making friends with similar interests. 

An opportunity for Chicago area cannabis consumers to get together and be social. Too often cannabis consumption has been looked down upon and laws have kept people indoors. We're all about connecting people in community to break down stereotypes and social stigma.

With medical cannabis dispensaries open and laws changing in Illinois this is our time to get together and have some fun.

Of course we cannot yet consume cannabis in public, but this will be a great opportunity for us all to meet more like minded people.

We will have some events at local restaurants, bars, beaches, and even some private homes.

Please join and we will schedule some times and dates to get together.

Our boundaries are ground rules for this community to grow sustainably and maintain a safe space for all cannabis consumers.

• no onsite consumption of cannabis during the event

• nonviolent communication and conflict resolutions

• mutual respect for everyone in our community
name: Cannabis 420 Social Club

description:
Living in Chicago as a conservative has got me empathizing with Johnathon Living Seagull. Just wanted to meet up with some like minded people who wouldn't accuse me of hating old people because I want to control my own retirement, or hating kids because I support choice in education.
Fair warning, I'm more of a conservative libertarian/ classical liberal, but in this city I'm not alienating anyone who doesn't want to light tax money on fire.
If you, like me, are feeling like the last sane person in a psych ward, let me know and we can grab a beer or something.
name: Chicago Conservatives Meetup

next_event.name: Meet Sanj Mohip - LP Chicago May Meeting

description: Meet Libertarians near you! Come to The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup to share your opinions on today's political climate and issues and learn how you can contribute to America's political future. Everyone interested in Libertarianism is welcome! Visit http://www.lpchicago.org and http://www.facebook.com/chicagolp for more information.
name: The Libertarian Party of Chicago Meetup Group

description:
We are a passionate group dedicated to ending violence and spreading a culture of peace with local and global communities.

If you love peace and desire to be the change - please join us in our campaign!
name: Calling an End to Gun Violence

description:
In just the first 10 days of his Presidency, Donald Trump has threatened undocumented immigrants with deportation, banned Muslim refugees and legal residents from seven countries and threatened to rollback decades of climate-change policy. 

No matter what you believe politically, these policies must be resisted.

As programmers, we can offer technical capabilities to civic groups that are on the front-lines of protecting those most affected by these policies. The goal is to organize a rapid-response team of programmers, web-developers and engineers from Chicago that can build tools and applications to aide sister-organizations scale their efforts.

First sprint-planning meeting is next week.
name: Code Progressive

organizer.bio: I'm Rebelle in Chief of Rebellious Magazine for Women , a Chicago-based online feminist publication that launched in March 2012 & relaunched in March 2016. I'm looking forward to connecting with other women entrepreneurs, business owners & Rebelles.
organizer.name: Karen Hawkins

description: Rebellious Magazine for Women is Chicago's most Rebellious feminist publication. This group is for anyone interested in joining our events & shenanigans, including the Annual Rebellious Magazine Feminist Prom Fundraiser. We're a diverse, inclusive & fun-loving group. Sometimes we raffle off vibrators.
name: Rebellious Magazine for Women

description:
Represent Us brings together conservatives, progressives, and everyone in between to pass powerful anti-corruption laws that stop political bribery, end secret money, and fix our broken elections.

Representation Day is a national day of action held annually by Represent.Us chapters all across the country. On Sunday, April 15, we are convening local groups and individuals working on democracy reform for a social event to to celebrate local successes and strengthen the anti-corruption movement in Illinois.
name: Represent Us: Chicagoland Anti-Corruption Meetup

description:
This group is for anyone interested in reading about economics in general or about social democracy/democratic socialism, broadly speaking, with no fixed ideology of any kind. People from any political background are welcome!

We might read: 

1. Contemporary texts like Thomas Piketty's "Capital in the Twenty-First Century," Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee's "The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies," Peter Diamandis and Steven Kotler's "Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think," Joseph Stiglitz's "The Price of Inequality: How Today's Divided Society Endangers Our Future," Matt Taibbi's "The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap," Richard Wolff's "Democracy at Work: A Cure for Capitalism," David Harvey's "Seventeen Contradictions and the End of Capitalism," Arundhati Roy's "Capitalism: A Ghost Story," Michael Mandelbaum's "The Road to Global Prosperity," Luigi Zingales's "A Capitalism for the People: Recapturing the Lost Genius of American Prosperity," John Micklethwait and Adrian Wooldridge's "The Fourth Revolution: The Global Race to Reinvent the State," or Timothy Geithner's "Stress Test: Reflections on Financial Crises."

2. Economics or economic history classics from authors like Appleby, Becker, Blaug, Collier, Cowen, Easterly, Eichengreen, Ferguson, Frieden, Friedman, Hayek, Heilbroner, Keynes, Krugman, Landes, Lind, Mankiw, Nasar, Polanyi, Rodrik, Rothbard, Sachs, Schumpeter, Shiller, Smith, Stiglitz, von Mises.

3. Democratic socialist classics from authors like Adorno, Allende, Bell, Bellamy, Chavez, Chomsky, Cohen, Cole, Davis, Debs, Dewey, Du Bois, Dyson, Ehrenreich, Engels, Gramsci, Habermas, Harrington, Harvey, Hayden, Hobsbawm, Hook, Horkheimer, Howe, Judt, King, Klein, Lipset, Luxemburg, Mandela, Marable, Marcuse, Marx, Mills, Nehru, Nichols, Niebuhr, Orwell, Piven, Rawls, Rorty, Russell, Shaw, Thomas, Thompson, Trotsky, the Webbs, West, Wilson, Zinn - or any others suggested by members! (I am no expert on the subject, and, after a political slumber, am only beginning to develop my knowledge of it.) 

We can organize the reading list democratically, with choice of selection by consensus or by a rotating member.
name: Chicago Economics & Social Democracy Reading Club

description:
If you think our country is falling apart because liberals and conservatives don't know how to talk to each other anymore, you’re right, and this meetup is for you. Here, we attempt to foster conversation across the liberal/conservative DMZ, focusing as much on casual experiences as on deeper conversations about the nature of politics and our political system.

Group leadership includes members from across the political spectrum, and all ideologies are welcome -- leftist to libertarian, tea party to teamster.
name: The Bridge: Liberal and Conservative Common Grounds

description:
Both political parties have some valuable ideas to offer, but politicians on both sides are too busy operating at the fringes of their own party to get anything done. We need to shake up the system with independents as well as left-leaning and right-leaning moderates!

Come out to chat about politics, make some friends with similar views, and help make an impact!
name: Unite America - Chicago Chapter

organizer.bio: I manage several Meetup Groups. Adding a few more.
organizer.name: Edmund Dantés Hamilton

description: Obama for Technology | Technology for Obama was created on My.BarackObama.com in February 2007 shortly after Barack Obama announced his intentions to run for President of the United States of America (POTUS). We are the "original" Technology for Obama group (just Google "Technology for Obama" or "Obama For Technology" and watch the videos, etc). Because I organize several Meetups, I've decided create this "Technology For Obama" Meetup Group to help get President Barack Obama reelected in 2012. Meetings will be held in my downtown Loop Chicago office. More details to follow. Join me in getting POTUS reelected so he can finish what he started and we can get the Jobs Act passed! Are you in?
name: Technology for Obama Meetup Group

organizer.bio: Beginners Spanish as a third language.
organizer.name: Stan Bartkus

description:
Help people vote their 'educated' opinions on issues local to Chicagoland.
National issues are NOT encouraged.
State issues are encouraged.
name: Chicago Republican Meetup

description:
People who are looking for an outlet from the current political climate and an opportunity to discuss activism opportunities and/or just vent. This group is right for you if...

1) You feel overwhelmed with the daily onslaught of crazy, coming out of the White House.

2) You are welcoming and respectful of people no matter their race, religion, gender or sexual identity.
name: Keeping Sane in the Insanity (K-Siti)!

description:
Protest is the new brunch.

But, we still want actual brunch too! We meet for monthly brunches at different restaurants in neighborhoods across the city. At brunch we partake in eggs, beverages of all kinds, and small actions to further the progressive agenda in this country.
name: The Mimosa Party

description:
This is a group to get together and learn about the issues of the day in a social -meet people- learn & - respect others venue.

This is 99% group so if you are in the 1% your ideas are welcome but will not be in the majority
name: Social Action Informed Network (SAIN)

description:
The Urantia Book, first published by Urantia Foundation in 1955, presents us with the origin, history, and destiny of humanity. It answers questions about God, life in the inhabited universe, the history and future of this world, and it includes an uplifting narrative of the life and teachings of Jesus.

The Urantia Book portrays our relationship with God the Father. All human beings are the sons and daughters of a loving God and therefore brothers and sisters in the family of God. The book provides new spiritual truth for modern men and women and a pathway to a personal relationship with God.

Building on the world's religious heritage, The Urantia Book describes an endless destiny for humankind, teaching that living faith is the key to personal spiritual progress and eternal survival. It also describes God’s plan for the progressive evolution of individuals, human society, and the universe as a whole.

Many people around the world have said that reading The Urantia Book has profoundly inspired them to reach deeper levels of spiritual growth. It has given them new meaning to life and the desire to be of service to humanity.

Official Site for First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://urantiachicago.org/

Official facebook 'page' site for the First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

https://www.facebook.com/theurantiabook/

Audio Versions

http://urantia-book.org/audio/iPod_Audiobook/index_ipod_audiobook.html

http://urantia-book.org/index_audio.htm

http://www.urantia.org/audio

http://truthbook.com/urantia-book/audio-downloads


THE FORUM STUDY GROUP meets in the Gallery Room at the United Church of Rogers Park (UCRP) http://www.ucrogerspark.org , located at the corner of Ashland Ave. (1600W) and Morse Ave. (6934N) in Chicago. Enter the UCRP building through the door at 1545 W. Morse Ave. If door is not open, ring the bell. Look for the signs directing you to the Gallery Room on the second floor. After entering, immediately turn left and proceed up one flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs, go through the doorway to the left, the Gallery Room is then to the right. There is also an elevator available which stops directly facing the Gallery Room.
name: First Society for Readers of The Urantia Book - Chicago

description:
The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) is the largest socialist organization in the United States, and the principal U.S. affiliate of the Socialist International. DSA's members are building progressive movements for social change while establishing an openly democratic socialist presence in American communities and politics.

At the root of our socialism is a profound commitment to democracy, as means and end. As we are unlikely to see an immediate end to capitalism tomorrow, DSA fights for reforms today that will weaken the power of corporations and increase the power of working people.
name: Chicago Democratic Socialists of America Chapter

description: Guns Save Life is a regional civil rights organization that works to educate the public about the benefits of firearm ownership. The group had its origins as a county grassroots committee of the Illinois State Rifle Association in about 1995, initially meeting in Rantoul, and later holding its monthly meetings in the Jolly Roger restaurant in Urbana, IL. GSL was later incorporated as its own non-profit corporation and today represent gun owners in Illinois, Indiana and beyond in proactive grassroots activism promoting and defending firearm rights and the civil right of self-defense. Guns Save Life’s Mission statement: To promote and educate the youth of America in the use of firearms and gun safety. To educate the population regarding the safe use of firearms and the history of firearms as they shaped our country from the pioneers through various wars to the present. To promote and encourage shooting sports available to all who wish to enjoy their benefits by offering hunter safety and marksmanship programs. To encourage the building of public shooting facilities to further educate the general population and those in politics who lack the knowledge of safe use of firearms and their importance to the well-being of the general public.
name: Guns Save Life, Inc
